intro: Brackenridgea nitida subsp. nitida, commonly known as the slender brackenridgea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and streambanks. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance.
